DOC.brief_summary: Contrast-induced nephropathy ( CIN ) represent potential complication diagnostic therapeutic procedure interventional cardiology , especially acute set primary PCI . The investigator test efficacy sodium bicarbonate ( NaHCO3 ) N-acetylcysteine ( NAC ) prevention acute event CIN patient acute myocardial infarction .
DOC.brief_title: Sodium Bicarbonate N-Acetylcysteine Nephroprotection Acute Myocardial Infarction
DOC.detailed_description: Introduction Contrast-induced nephropathy ( CIN ) represent potential complication diagnostic therapeutic procedure interventional cardiology . In set elective procedure , strategy sodium bicarbonate ( NaHCO3 ) N-acetylcysteine ( NAC ) infusion show reduce incidence CIN high-risk patient . The efficacy strategy demonstrate case primary percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) . Aim study The aim ass efficacy strategy sodium bicarbonate 154mEq/l + glucose solution 5 % ( infusion rate : 3 mL • kg-1 • h-1 1 hour follow 1 mL • kg-1 • h-1 6 hour ) NAC ( 1200 mg i.v . follow 1200 mg bid next 48 hour ) reduce incidence CIN patient STEMI undergoing primary rescue PCI . As control group , population STEMI patient treat NAC ( 1200 mg i.v . follow 1200 mg bid next 48 hour ) + conventional hydration saline solution 0.9 % retrospectively enrol . According common definition , CIN define increase level serum creatinine > 0,5 mg/dL and/or increase ≥25 % serum creatinine and/or decrease ≥25 % glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) calculate MDRD Modification Diet Renal Disease ) formula 48 hour PCI compare baseline value primary PCI . Study Design This two-center ( Policlinico Gemelli Policlinico Casilino , Rome , Italy ) , prospective , spontaneous ( sponsor ) observational study . Patient population Inclusion criterion : - Consecutive patient ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction ( STEMI ) diagnose accord ACC ( American College Cardiology ) criterion : - ischemic symptom ; - ECG variation : ST-elevation ( > 0,05 mV ) two contiguous lead ; - Increase biochemical marker myocardial necrosis ( troponin T , cTNT ) . - Indication urgent coronary angiography primary rescue PCI Exclusion criterion : - Patients history allergic reaction NAC ( Fluimucil , Zambon Group Spa , Milan , Italy ) - Chronic hemodialysis - Age > 90 year Study protocol Patients treat 154 mEq/L sodium bicarbonate glucose 5 % solution ( infusion rate 3 mL • kg-1 • h-1 1 hour follow 1 mL • kg-1 • h-1 6 hour ) plus NAC ( 1200 mg i.v . follow 1200 mg bid next 48 hour ) . As control group , population STEMI patient treat conventional hydration saline solution 0,9 % NAC ( 1200 mg i.v . follow 1200 mg bid next 48 hour ) accord common clinical practice Department Cardiovascular Medicine Policlinico Agostino Gemelli Cardiology Department Policlinico Casilino retrospectively enrol . Endpoints : Primary endpoint : - Composite endpoint ( death/need dialysis/CIN ) Secondary endpoint : - assessment individual major adverse event ( death , re-infarction , need dialysis ) 1 , 6 12 month - assessment incidence CIN define increase level serum creatinine > 0,5 mg/dL and/or increase ≥25 % serum creatinine and/or decrease ≥25 % glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) calculate MDRD formula 48 hour PCI compare baseline value .
DOC.criteria: STSegment Elevation Myocardial Infarction ( STEMI ) diagnose accord ACC ( American College Cardiology ) criterion : ischemic symptom ; ECG variation : STelevation ( > 0,05 mV ) two contiguous lead ; Increase biochemical marker myocardial necrosis ( troponin T , cTNT ) . • Indication urgent coronary angiography primary rescue PCI Patients history allergic reaction NAC Chronic hemodialysis Age > = 90 year
